pageContext.claim: “It was always told to me that you needed a constitutional amendment [to revoke birthright citizenship]. Guess what? You don’t. …You can definitely do it with an act of Congress. But, now they're saying I can do it just with an executive order.”
pageContext.analysis: The president is wrong to claim that he can change the 14th Amendment to the Constitution by himself, with an executive order. That's not how government works. It's also wrong to claim that Congress could make the change by passing a law. In fact, a constitutional amendment would be needed, according to legal experts on both sides of the debate, and according to Democrats and Republicans in Congress.
